title: "India needs more local language models, datasets to bridge digital divide"
excerpt: "India is home to more than 400 languages, making it one of the most linguistically diverse countries in the world. Hindi alone has 48 official dialects, and Bengali has about 50 variants. But large language models, or LLMs, are trained primarily using internet data, which is predominantly English."
